title: Geometric Mnemic Manifolds: A Foveated Architecture for Autonoetic Memory in LLMs
description: A novel architecture for simulating the functional dynamics of autonoetic memory in AI systems. This system departs from the industry standard of stochastic Vector Databases by introducing the Geometric Mnemic Manifold, where a Recursive Reasoning Kernel (RRK) acts as a fluid reasoning engine, offloading long-term memory to a distributed graph of immutable Engrams organized along a deterministic, low-discrepancy trajectory utilizing Kronecker sequences.
references: Tulving, E. (1985). Memory and consciousness. Canadian Psychology, 26(1), 1-12.
Park, J. S., et al. (2023). Generative Agents: Interactive Simulacra of Human Behavior. UIST.
